Skylink.name: Skylink

classitems.description:
The list of datachannel states.
- Check out the [w3 specification documentation](http://dev.w3.org/2011/
  webrtc/editor/webrtc.html#idl-def-RTCDataChannelState).
- This is the RTCDataChannelState of the peer.
- <u>ERROR</u> is an additional implemented state by Skylink
  for further error tracking.
- The states that would occur are:
classitems.name: DATA_CHANNEL_STATE

params.name: CONNECTING
params.description:
The user agent is attempting to establish
  the underlying data transport. This is the initial state of a
  RTCDataChannel object created with createDataChannel().

params.name: OPEN
params.description:
The underlying data transport is established
  and communication is possible. This is the initial state of a
  RTCDataChannel object dispatched as a part of a RTCDataChannelEvent.

params.name: CLOSING
params.description:
The procedure to close down the underlying
  data transport has started.

params.name: CLOSED
params.description:
The underlying data transport has been closed
  or could not be established.

params.name: ERROR
params.description: Datachannel has occurred an error.

classitems.description:
The list of datachannel message types.
- These are the list of available datachannel message types expected to
  be received.
- These message types are fixed.
- The available message types are:
classitems.name: _DC_PROTOCOL_TYPE

params.name:
WRQ
-
params.description:
Send: User request to transfer a data.
- Received: A peer has requested to transfer a data.

params.name:
ACK
-
params.description:
Send: User response to data transfer request.
- Received: Response from peer towards data transfer.
  - -1: Peer has rejected data transfer request.
  - 0: Peer has accepted data transfer request.
  - >0: Data transfer is going on.

params.name:
CANCEL
-
params.description:
Send: User canceled data transfer.
- Received: A peer has canceled data transfer.

params.name:
ERROR
-
params.description:
Send: Timeout waiting for peer response has exceeded limit.
- Received: Response from peer that timeout has reached its limit.
  Data transfer has failed.

params.name:
MESSAGE
-
params.description:
Send: User sends a P2P message.
- Received: A peer has sent a P2P message.

classitems.description:
The list of ICE candidate generation states.
- Check out the [w3 specification documentation](http://dev.w3.org/2011/
  webrtc/editor/webrtc.html#rtcicegatheringstate-enum).
- This is RTCIceGatheringState of the peer.
- The states that would occur are:
classitems.name: CANDIDATE_GENERATION_STATE

params.name: NEW
params.description:
The object was just created, and no networking
  has occurred yet.

params.name: GATHERING
params.description:
The ICE engine is in the process of gathering
  candidates for this RTCPeerConnection.

params.name: COMPLETED
params.description:
The ICE engine has completed gathering. Events
  such as adding a new interface or a new TURN server will cause the
  state to go back to gathering.

classitems.description: Internal array of peer ice candidates queue.
classitems.name: _peerCandidatesQueue

classitems.description:
A candidate has just been generated (ICE gathering) and will be sent to the peer.
Part of connection establishment.
classitems.name: _onIceCandidate

params.name: event
params.description: This is provided directly by the peerconnection API.

classitems.description: Adds ice candidate to queue.
classitems.name: _addIceCandidateToQueue

params.name: targetMid
params.description: The peerId of the target peer.

params.name: candidate
params.description: The ice candidate object.

classitems.description: Adds all ice candidate from the queue.
classitems.name: _addIceCandidateFromQueue

params.name: targetMid
params.description: The peerId of the target peer.

classitems.description: The current state if ICE trickle is enabled.
classitems.name: _enableIceTrickle

classitems.description:
The list of ICE connection states.
- Check out the [w3 specification documentation](http://dev.w3.org/2011/
  webrtc/editor/webrtc.html#rtciceconnectionstate-enum).
- This is the RTCIceConnection state of the peer.
- The states that would occur are:
classitems.name: ICE_CONNECTION_STATE

params.name: STARTING
params.description:
The ICE agent is gathering addresses
  and/or waiting for remote candidates to be supplied.

params.name: CHECKING
params.description:
The ICE agent has received remote candidates
  on at least one component, and is checking candidate pairs but has
  not yet found a connection. In addition to checking, it may also
  still be gathering.

params.name: CONNECTED
params.description:
The ICE agent has found a usable connection
  for all components but is still checking other candidate pairs to see
  if there is a better connection. It may also still be gathering.

params.name: COMPLETED
params.description:
The ICE agent has finished gathering and
  checking and found a connection for all components.

params.name: FAILED
params.description:
The ICE agent is finished checking all
  candidate pairs and failed to find a connection for at least one
  component.

params.name: DISCONNECTED
params.description:
Liveness checks have failed for one or
  more components. This is more aggressive than "failed", and may
  trigger intermittently (and resolve itself without action) on
  a flaky network.

params.name: CLOSED
params.description:
The ICE agent has shut down and is no
  longer responding to STUN requests.

classitems.description:
The list of peer connection states.
- Check out the [w3 specification documentation](http://dev.w3.org/2011/
  webrtc/editor/webrtc.html#rtcpeerstate-enum).
- This is the RTCSignalingState of the peer.
- The states that would occur are:
classitems.name: PEER_CONNECTION_STATE

params.name: STABLE
params.description:
There is no offer/answer exchange in progress.
  This is also the initial state in which case the local and remote
  descriptions are empty.

params.name: HAVE_LOCAL_OFFER
params.description:
A local description, of type "offer",
  has been successfully applied.

params.name: HAVE_REMOTE_OFFER
params.description:
A remote description, of type "offer",
  has been successfully applied.

params.name: HAVE_LOCAL_PRANSWER
params.description:
A remote description of type "offer"
  has been successfully applied and a local description of type "pranswer"
  has been successfully applied.

params.name: HAVE_REMOTE_PRANSWER
params.description:
A local description of type "offer"
  has been successfully applied and a remote description of type
  "pranswer" has been successfully applied.

params.name: CLOSED
params.description: The connection is closed.

The list of handshake progress steps.
- This are the list of steps for the Skylink peer connection.
- The steps that would occur are:
classitems.name: HANDSHAKE_PROGRESS

params.name: ENTER
params.description: Step 1. Received "enter" from peer.

params.name: WELCOME
params.description: Step 2. Received "welcome" from peer.

params.name: OFFER
params.description: Step 3. Received "offer" from peer.

params.name: ANSWER
params.description: Step 4. Received "answer" from peer.

params.name: ERROR
params.description: Error state.

User sends quick messages

Room is locked and user is locked

params.name: ROOM_FULL

params.name: SERVER_ERROR

params.name: ROOM_CLOSED

Persistent meeting. Room

params.name: ROOM_CLOSING
params.description:
Persistent meeting.
  Room is closing soon.

params.name: OVER_SEAT_LIMIT
params.description:
Seat limit is hit. API Key

classitems.description:
The list of api server data retrieval state.
- These are the states to inform the state of retrieving the
  information from the api server required to start the peer
  connection or if the browser is eligible to start the peer connection.
- This is the first event that would fired, because Skylink would retrieve
  information from the api server that is required to start the connection.
- Once the state is <u>COMPLETED</u>, Skylink is ready to start the call.
- The states that would occur are:
classitems.name: READY_STATE_CHANGE

params.name: INIT
params.description:
Skylink has just started. No information are
  retrieved yet.

params.name: LOADING
params.description:
Skylink is starting the retrieval of the
  connection information.

params.name: COMPLETED
params.description:
Skylink has completed retrieving the
  connection.

params.name: ERROR
params.description:
Skylink has occurred an error when
  retrieving the connection information.

classitems.description: The list of ready state change errors. - These are the error states from the error object error code. - ROOM_LOCKED is deprecated in 0.5.2. Please use {{#crossLink "Skylink/:attr"}}leaveRoom(){{/crossLink}} - The states that would occur are:
classitems.name: READY_STATE_CHANGE_ERROR

classitems.description: Intiailize Skylink to retrieve connection information. - IMPORTANT: Please call this method to load all server information before joining the room or doing anything else. - If you would like to set the start time and duration of the room, you have to generate the credentials. In example 3, we use the [CryptoJS](https://code.google.com/p/crypto-js/) library. - Step 1: Generate the hash. It is created by using the roomname, duration and the timestamp (in ISO String format). - Step 2: Generate the Credentials. It is is generated by converting the hash to a Base64 string and then encoding it to a URI string. - Step 3: Initialize Skylink

classitems.description:
The list of ICE connection states.
- Check out the [w3 specification documentation](http://dev.w3.org/2011/
  webrtc/editor/webrtc.html#rtciceconnectionstate-enum).
- This is the RTCIceConnection state of the peer.
- The states that would occur are:
classitems.name: ICE_CONNECTION_STATE

params.name: STARTING
params.description:
The ICE agent is gathering addresses
  and/or waiting for remote candidates to be supplied.

params.name: CHECKING
params.description:
The ICE agent has received remote candidates
  on at least one component, and is checking candidate pairs but has
  not yet found a connection. In addition to checking, it may also
  still be gathering.

params.name: CONNECTED
params.description:
The ICE agent has found a usable connection
  for all components but is still checking other candidate pairs to see
  if there is a better connection. It may also still be gathering.

params.name: COMPLETED
params.description:
The ICE agent has finished gathering and
  checking and found a connection for all components.

params.name: FAILED
params.description:
The ICE agent is finished checking all
  candidate pairs and failed to find a connection for at least one
  component.

params.name: DISCONNECTED
params.description:
Liveness checks have failed for one or
  more components. This is more aggressive than "failed", and may
  trigger intermittently (and resolve itself without action) on
  a flaky network.

params.name: CLOSED
params.description:
The ICE agent has shut down and is no
  longer responding to STUN requests.

classitems.description:
The log levels.
- Logs are shown based on the level, if the level is highest, it shows logs
  which level are lower than theirs. If the level is lower, it shows only
  logs that are lower or are the same level, not the higher ones.
- Order from lowest to the highest is: error > warn > info > log > debug.
classitems.name: PEER_CONNECTION_STATE

params.name: DEBUG
params.description: Level 5. Shows debug logs.

params.name: TRACE
params.description: Level 4. Shows trace logs.

params.name: INFO
params.description: Level 3. Show informational logs related to user.

params.name: WARN
params.description: Level 2. Shows warnings.

params.name: ERROR
params.description:
Level 1. Shows the errors that are thrown during
  execution.

The fixed for each data chunk for firefox implementation.

classitems.description:
The list of signaling message types.
- These are the list of available signaling message types expected to
  be received.
- These message types are fixed.
- The available message types are:
classitems.name: _SIG_MESSAGE_TYPE

params.name:
JOIN_ROOM
-
params.description: Send: User request to join the room.

params.name:
IN_ROOM
-
params.description: Received: Response from server that user has joined the room.

params.name:
ENTER
-
params.description:
Send: Broadcast message to inform other connected peers in the room
  that the user is the new peer joining the room.
- Received: A peer has just joined the room.
  To send a welcome message.

params.name:
WELCOME
-
params.description:
Send: Respond to user to request peer to create the offer.
- Received: Response from peer that peer acknowledges the user has
  joined the room. To send and create an offer message.

params.name:
OFFER
-
params.description:
Send: Respond to peer's request to create an offer.
- Received: Response from peer's offer message. User to create and
  send an answer message.

params.name:
ANSWER
-
params.description:
Send: Response to peer's offer message.
- Received: Response from peer's answer message.
  Connection is established.

params.name:
CANDIDATE
-
params.description:
Send: User to send the ICE candidate after onicecandidate is called.
- Received: User to add peer's ice candidate in addIceCandidate.

params.name:
BYE
-
params.description: Received: Peer has left the room.

params.name:
REDIRECT
-
params.description: Received: Server warning to user.

params.name:
ERROR
-
params.description: Received: Deprecated. Server error occurred.

params.name:
UPDATE_USER
-
params.description:
Send: User's custom data is updated and to inform other peers
  of updated custom data.
- Received: Peer's user custom data has changed.

params.name:
ROOM_LOCK
-
params.description:
Send: Room lock action has changed and to inform other peers
  of updated room lock status.
- Received: Room lock status has changed.

params.name:
MUTE_VIDEO
-
params.description:
Send: User has muted video and to inform other peers
  of updated muted video stream status.
- Received: Peer muted video status has changed.

params.name:
MUTE_AUDIO
-
params.description:
Send: User has muted audio and to inform other peers
  of updated muted audio stream status.
- Received: Peer muted audio status has changed.

params.name:
PUBLIC_MESSAGE
-
params.description:
Send: User sends a broadcast message to all peers.
- Received: User receives a peer's broadcast message.

params.name:
PRIVATE_MESSAGE
-
params.description:
Send: User sends a private message to a peer.
- Received: User receives a private message from a peer.

classitems.description:
The list of datachannel message types.
- These are the list of available datachannel message types expected to
  be received.
- These message types are fixed.
- The available message types are:
classitems.name: _DC_PROTOCOL_TYPE

params.name:
WRQ
-
params.description:
Send: User request to transfer a data.
- Received: A peer has requested to transfer a data.

params.name:
ACK
-
params.description:
Send: User response to data transfer request.
- Received: Response from peer towards data transfer.
  - -1: Peer has rejected data transfer request.
  - 0: Peer has accepted data transfer request.
  - >0: Data transfer is going on.

params.name:
CANCEL
-
params.description:
Send: User canceled data transfer.
- Received: A peer has canceled data transfer.

params.name:
ERROR
-
params.description:
Send: Timeout waiting for peer response has exceeded limit.
- Received: Response from peer that timeout has reached its limit.
  Data transfer has failed.

params.name:
MESSAGE
-
params.description:
Send: User sends a P2P message.
- Received: A peer has sent a P2P message.

classitems.description:
The list of available regional servers.
- This is for developers to set the nearest region server
  for Skylink to connect to for faster connectivity.
- The available regional servers are:
classitems.name: REGIONAL_SERVER

params.name: APAC1
params.description: Asia pacific server 1.

params.name: US1
params.description: server 1.

classitems.description:
The list of ICE connection states.
- Check out the [w3 specification documentation](http://dev.w3.org/2011/
  webrtc/editor/webrtc.html#rtciceconnectionstate-enum).
- This is the RTCIceConnection state of the peer.
- The states that would occur are:
classitems.name: ICE_CONNECTION_STATE

params.name: STARTING
params.description:
The ICE agent is gathering addresses
  and/or waiting for remote candidates to be supplied.

params.name: CHECKING
params.description:
The ICE agent has received remote candidates
  on at least one component, and is checking candidate pairs but has
  not yet found a connection. In addition to checking, it may also
  still be gathering.

params.name: CONNECTED
params.description:
The ICE agent has found a usable connection
  for all components but is still checking other candidate pairs to see
  if there is a better connection. It may also still be gathering.

params.name: COMPLETED
params.description:
The ICE agent has finished gathering and
  checking and found a connection for all components.

params.name: FAILED
params.description:
The ICE agent is finished checking all
  candidate pairs and failed to find a connection for at least one
  component.

params.name: DISCONNECTED
params.description:
Liveness checks have failed for one or
  more components. This is more aggressive than "failed", and may
  trigger intermittently (and resolve itself without action) on
  a flaky network.

params.name: CLOSED
params.description:
The ICE agent has shut down and is no
  longer responding to STUN requests.

classitems.description:
The list of peer connection states.
- Check out the [w3 specification documentation](http://dev.w3.org/2011/
  webrtc/editor/webrtc.html#rtcpeerstate-enum).
- This is the RTCSignalingState of the peer.
- The states that would occur are:
classitems.name: PEER_CONNECTION_STATE

params.name: STABLE
params.description:
There is no offer/answer exchange in progress.
  This is also the initial state in which case the local and remote
  descriptions are empty.

params.name: HAVE_LOCAL_OFFER
params.description:
A local description, of type "offer",
  has been successfully applied.

params.name: HAVE_REMOTE_OFFER
params.description:
A remote description, of type "offer",
  has been successfully applied.

params.name: HAVE_LOCAL_PRANSWER
params.description:
A remote description of type "offer"
  has been successfully applied and a local description of type "pranswer"
  has been successfully applied.

params.name: HAVE_REMOTE_PRANSWER
params.description:
A local description of type "offer"
  has been successfully applied and a remote description of type
  "pranswer" has been successfully applied.

params.name: CLOSED
params.description: The connection is closed.

classitems.description:
The list of ICE candidate generation states.
- Check out the [w3 specification documentation](http://dev.w3.org/2011/
  webrtc/editor/webrtc.html#rtcicegatheringstate-enum).
- This is RTCIceGatheringState of the peer.
- The states that would occur are:
classitems.name: CANDIDATE_GENERATION_STATE

params.name: NEW
params.description:
The object was just created, and no networking
  has occurred yet.

params.name: GATHERING
params.description:
The ICE engine is in the process of gathering
  candidates for this RTCPeerConnection.

params.name: COMPLETED
params.description:
The ICE engine has completed gathering. Events
  such as adding a new interface or a new TURN server will cause the
  state to go back to gathering.

classitems.description:
The list of handshake progress steps.
- This are the list of steps for the Skylink peer connection.
- The steps that would occur are:
classitems.name: HANDSHAKE_PROGRESS

params.name: ENTER
params.description: Step 1. Received "enter" from peer.

params.name: WELCOME
params.description: Step 2. Received "welcome" from peer.

params.name: OFFER
params.description: Step 3. Received "offer" from peer.

params.name: ANSWER
params.description: Step 4. Received "answer" from peer.

params.name: ERROR
params.description: Error state.

classitems.description:
The list of datachannel states.
- Check out the [w3 specification documentation](http://dev.w3.org/2011/
  webrtc/editor/webrtc.html#idl-def-RTCDataChannelState).
- This is the RTCDataChannelState of the peer.
- <u>ERROR</u> is an additional implemented state by Skylink
  for further error tracking.
- The states that would occur are:
classitems.name: DATA_CHANNEL_STATE

params.name: CONNECTING
params.description:
The user agent is attempting to establish
  the underlying data transport. This is the initial state of a
  RTCDataChannel object created with createDataChannel().

params.name: OPEN
params.description:
The underlying data transport is established
  and communication is possible. This is the initial state of a
  RTCDataChannel object dispatched as a part of a RTCDataChannelEvent.

params.name: CLOSING
params.description:
The procedure to close down the underlying
  data transport has started.

params.name: CLOSED
params.description:
The underlying data transport has been closed
  or could not be established.

params.name: ERROR
params.description: Datachannel has occurred an error.

classitems.description:
The list of api server data retrieval state.
- These are the states to inform the state of retrieving the
  information from the api server required to start the peer
  connection or if the browser is eligible to start the peer connection.
- This is the first event that would fired, because Skylink would retrieve
  information from the api server that is required to start the connection.
- Once the state is <u>COMPLETED</u>, Skylink is ready to start the call.
- The states that would occur are:
classitems.name: READY_STATE_CHANGE

params.name: INIT
params.description:
Skylink has just started. No information are
  retrieved yet.

params.name: LOADING
params.description:
Skylink is starting the retrieval of the
  connection information.

params.name: COMPLETED
params.description:
Skylink has completed retrieving the
  connection.

params.name: ERROR
params.description:
Skylink has occurred an error when
  retrieving the connection information.

classitems.description: The list of ready state change errors. - These are the error states from the error object error code. - ROOM_LOCKED is deprecated in 0.5.2. Please use {{#crossLink "Skylink/:attr"}}leaveRoom(){{/crossLink}} - The states that would occur are:
classitems.name: READY_STATE_CHANGE_ERROR

params.name: API_INVALID

Api Key used in domain does

params.name: API_INVALID_PARENT_KEY

params.name: API_NOT_ENOUGH_CREDIT

params.name: API_NOT_ENOUGH_PREPAID_CREDIT

params.name: API_FAILED_FINDING_PREPAID_CREDIT

  payments does not exist.

params.name: API_NO_MEETING_RECORD_FOUND

params.name: ROOM_LOCKED
params.description: Room is locked.

params.name: NO_SOCKET_IO
params.description: No socket.io dependency is loaded to use.

params.name: NO_XMLHTTPREQUEST_SUPPORT
params.description:
Browser does not support
  XMLHttpRequest to use.

params.name: NO_WEBRTC_SUPPORT
params.description: Browser does not have WebRTC support.

params.name: NO_PATH
params.description: No path is loaded yet.

params.name: INVALID_XMLHTTPREQUEST_STATUS
params.description:
Invalid XMLHttpRequest
  when retrieving information.

Data download transfer has been

classitems.description:
The list of signaling actions received.
- These are usually received from the signaling server to warn the user.
- The system action outcomes are:
classitems.name: SYSTEM_ACTION_REASON

params.name: FAST_MESSAGE
params.description:
User sends quick messages
  less than a second resulting in a warning. Continuous
  quick messages results in user being kicked out of the room.

params.name: ROOM_LOCKED
params.description:
Room is locked and user is locked
  from joining the room.

params.name: ROOM_FULL
params.description: Persistent meeting. Room is full.

params.name: DUPLICATED_LOGIN
params.description: User has same id

params.name: SERVER_ERROR
params.description: Server has an error

params.name: VERIFICATION
params.description: Verification for roomID

params.name: EXPIRED
params.description:
Persistent meeting. Room has
  expired and user is unable to join the room.

params.name: ROOM_CLOSED
params.description:
Persistent meeting. Room
  has expired and is closed, user to leave the room.

params.name: ROOM_CLOSING
params.description:
Persistent meeting.
  Room is closing soon.

params.name: OVER_SEAT_LIMIT
params.description:
Seat limit is hit. API Key
  do not have sufficient seats to continue.

classitems.description: Intiailize Skylink to retrieve connection information. - IMPORTANT: Please call this method to load all server information before joining the room or doing anything else. - If you would like to set the start time and duration of the room, you have to generate the credentials. In example 3, we use the [CryptoJS](https://code.google.com/p/crypto-js/) library. - Step 1: Generate the hash. It is created by using the roomname, duration and the timestamp (in ISO String format). - Step 2: Generate the Credentials. It is is generated by converting the hash to a Base64 string and then encoding it to a URI string. - Step 3: Initialize Skylink

classitems.description:
The list of ICE connection states.
- Check out the [w3 specification documentation](http://dev.w3.org/2011/
  webrtc/editor/webrtc.html#rtciceconnectionstate-enum).
- This is the RTCIceConnection state of the peer.
- The states that would occur are:
classitems.name: ICE_CONNECTION_STATE

params.name: STARTING
params.description:
The ICE agent is gathering addresses
  and/or waiting for remote candidates to be supplied.

params.name: CHECKING
params.description:
The ICE agent has received remote candidates
  on at least one component, and is checking candidate pairs but has
  not yet found a connection. In addition to checking, it may also
  still be gathering.

params.name: CONNECTED
params.description:
The ICE agent has found a usable connection
  for all components but is still checking other candidate pairs to see
  if there is a better connection. It may also still be gathering.

params.name: COMPLETED
params.description:
The ICE agent has finished gathering and
  checking and found a connection for all components.

params.name: FAILED
params.description:
The ICE agent is finished checking all
  candidate pairs and failed to find a connection for at least one
  component.

params.name: DISCONNECTED
params.description:
Liveness checks have failed for one or
  more components. This is more aggressive than "failed", and may
  trigger intermittently (and resolve itself without action) on
  a flaky network.

params.name: CLOSED
params.description:
The ICE agent has shut down and is no
  longer responding to STUN requests.

classitems.description: Intiailize Skylink to retrieve connection information. - IMPORTANT: Please call this method to load all server information before joining the room or doing anything else. - If you would like to set the start time and duration of the room, you have to generate the credentials. In example 3, we use the [CryptoJS](https://code.google.com/p/crypto-js/) library. - Step 1: Generate the hash. It is created by using the roomname, duration and the timestamp (in ISO String format). - Step 2: Generate the Credentials. It is is generated by converting the hash to a Base64 string and then encoding it to a URI string. - Step 3: Initialize Skylink
classitems.name: init

classitems.description:
The log levels.
- Logs are shown based on the level, if the level is highest, it shows logs
  which level are lower than theirs. If the level is lower, it shows only
  logs that are lower or are the same level, not the higher ones.
- Order from lowest to the highest is: error > warn > info > log > debug.
classitems.name: PEER_CONNECTION_STATE

params.name: DEBUG
params.description: Level 5. Shows debug logs.

params.name: TRACE
params.description: Level 4. Shows trace logs.

params.name: INFO
params.description: Level 3. Show informational logs related to user.

params.name: WARN
params.description: Level 2. Shows warnings.

params.name: ERROR
params.description:
Level 1. Shows the errors that are thrown during
  execution.

The fixed for each data chunk for firefox implementation.
- Firefox the sender chunks 49152 but receives as 16384.
classitems.name: _MOZ_CHUNK_FILE_SIZE

classitems.description:
The list of signaling message types.
- These are the list of available signaling message types expected to
  be received.
- These message types are fixed.
- The available message types are:
classitems.name: _SIG_MESSAGE_TYPE

params.name:
JOIN_ROOM
-
params.description: Send: User request to join the room.

params.name:
IN_ROOM
-
params.description: Received: Response from server that user has joined the room.

params.name:
ENTER
-
params.description:
Send: Broadcast message to inform other connected peers in the room
  that the user is the new peer joining the room.
- Received: A peer has just joined the room.
  To send a welcome message.

params.name:
WELCOME
-
params.description:
Send: Respond to user to request peer to create the offer.
- Received: Response from peer that peer acknowledges the user has
  joined the room. To send and create an offer message.

params.name:
OFFER
-
params.description:
Send: Respond to peer's request to create an offer.
- Received: Response from peer's offer message. User to create and
  send an answer message.

params.name:
ANSWER
-
params.description:
Send: Response to peer's offer message.
- Received: Response from peer's answer message.
  Connection is established.

params.name:
CANDIDATE
-
params.description:
Send: User to send the ICE candidate after onicecandidate is called.
- Received: User to add peer's ice candidate in addIceCandidate.

params.name:
BYE
-
params.description: Received: Peer has left the room.

params.name:
REDIRECT
-
params.description: Received: Server warning to user.

params.name:
ERROR
-
params.description: Received: Deprecated. Server error occurred.

params.name:
UPDATE_USER
-
params.description:
Send: User's custom data is updated and to inform other peers
  of updated custom data.
- Received: Peer's user custom data has changed.

params.name:
ROOM_LOCK
-
params.description:
Send: Room lock action has changed and to inform other peers
  of updated room lock status.
- Received: Room lock status has changed.

params.name:
MUTE_VIDEO
-
params.description:
Send: User has muted video and to inform other peers
  of updated muted video stream status.
- Received: Peer muted video status has changed.

params.name:
MUTE_AUDIO
-
params.description:
Send: User has muted audio and to inform other peers
  of updated muted audio stream status.
- Received: Peer muted audio status has changed.

params.name:
PUBLIC_MESSAGE
-
params.description:
Send: User sends a broadcast message to all peers.
- Received: User receives a peer's broadcast message.

params.name:
PRIVATE_MESSAGE
-
params.description:
Send: User sends a private message to a peer.
- Received: User receives a private message from a peer.

classitems.description:
The list of datachannel message types.
- These are the list of available datachannel message types expected to
  be received.
- These message types are fixed.
- The available message types are:
classitems.name: _DC_PROTOCOL_TYPE

params.name:
WRQ
-
params.description:
Send: User request to transfer a data.
- Received: A peer has requested to transfer a data.

params.name:
ACK
-
params.description:
Send: User response to data transfer request.
- Received: Response from peer towards data transfer.
  - -1: Peer has rejected data transfer request.
  - 0: Peer has accepted data transfer request.
  - >0: Data transfer is going on.

params.name:
CANCEL
-
params.description:
Send: User canceled data transfer.
- Received: A peer has canceled data transfer.

params.name:
ERROR
-
params.description:
Send: Timeout waiting for peer response has exceeded limit.

MESSAGE

params.description:

- Received: A peer has sent a P2P message.

classitems.description:
The list of available regional servers.

params.name: APAC1
params.description: Asia pacific server 1.

params.name: US1
params.description: server 1.

classitems.description:
The list of ICE connection states.
- Check out the [w3 specification documentation](http://dev.w3.org/2011/
  webrtc/editor/webrtc.html#rtciceconnectionstate-enum).
- This is the RTCIceConnection state of the peer.
- The states that would occur are:
classitems.name: ICE_CONNECTION_STATE

params.name: STARTING
params.description:
The ICE agent is gathering addresses
  and/or waiting for remote candidates to be supplied.

params.name: CHECKING
params.description:
The ICE agent has received remote candidates
  on at least one component, and is checking candidate pairs but has
  not yet found a connection. In addition to checking, it may also
  still be gathering.

params.name: CONNECTED
params.description:
The ICE agent has found a usable connection
  for all components but is still checking other candidate pairs to see
  if there is a better connection. It may also still be gathering.

params.name: COMPLETED
params.description:
The ICE agent has finished gathering and
  checking and found a connection for all components.

params.name: FAILED
params.description:
The ICE agent is finished checking all
  candidate pairs and failed to find a connection for at least one
  component.

params.name: DISCONNECTED
params.description:
Liveness checks have failed for one or
  more components. This is more aggressive than "failed", and may
  trigger intermittently (and resolve itself without action) on
  a flaky network.

params.name: CLOSED
params.description:
The ICE agent has shut down and is no
  longer responding to STUN requests.

classitems.description:
The list of peer connection states.
- Check out the [w3 specification documentation](http://dev.w3.org/2011/
  webrtc/editor/webrtc.html#rtcpeerstate-enum).
- This is the RTCSignalingState of the peer.
- The states that would occur are:
classitems.name: PEER_CONNECTION_STATE

params.name: STABLE
params.description:
There is no offer/answer exchange in progress.
  This is also the initial state in which case the local and remote
  descriptions are empty.

params.name: HAVE_LOCAL_OFFER
params.description:
A local description, of type "offer",
  has been successfully applied.

params.name: HAVE_REMOTE_OFFER
params.description:
A remote description, of type "offer",
  has been successfully applied.

params.name: HAVE_LOCAL_PRANSWER
params.description:
A remote description of type "offer"
  has been successfully applied and a local description of type "pranswer"
  has been successfully applied.

params.name: HAVE_REMOTE_PRANSWER
params.description:
A local description of type "offer"
  has been successfully applied and a remote description of type
  "pranswer" has been successfully applied.

params.name: CLOSED
params.description: The connection is closed.

classitems.description:
The list of ICE candidate generation states.
- Check out the [w3 specification documentation](http://dev.w3.org/2011/
  webrtc/editor/webrtc.html#rtcicegatheringstate-enum).
- This is RTCIceGatheringState of the peer.
- The states that would occur are:
classitems.name: CANDIDATE_GENERATION_STATE

params.name: NEW
params.description:
The object was just created, and no networking
  has occurred yet.

params.name: GATHERING
params.description:
The ICE engine is in the process of gathering
  candidates for this RTCPeerConnection.

params.name: COMPLETED
params.description:
The ICE engine has completed gathering. Events
  such as adding a new interface or a new TURN server will cause the
  state to go back to gathering.

classitems.description:
The list of handshake progress steps.
- This are the list of steps for the Skylink peer connection.
- The steps that would occur are:
classitems.name: HANDSHAKE_PROGRESS

params.name: ENTER
params.description: Step 1. Received "enter" from peer.

params.name: WELCOME
params.description: Step 2. Received "welcome" from peer.

params.name: OFFER
params.description: Step 3. Received "offer" from peer.

params.name: ANSWER
params.description: Step 4. Received "answer" from peer.

params.name: ERROR
params.description: Error state.

classitems.description:
The list of datachannel states.
- Check out the [w3 specification documentation](http://dev.w3.org/2011/
  webrtc/editor/webrtc.html#idl-def-RTCDataChannelState).
- This is the RTCDataChannelState of the peer.
- <u>ERROR</u> is an additional implemented state by Skylink
  for further error tracking.
- The states that would occur are:
classitems.name: DATA_CHANNEL_STATE

params.name: CONNECTING
params.description:
The user agent is attempting to establish
  the underlying data transport. This is the initial state of a
  RTCDataChannel object created with createDataChannel().

params.name: OPEN
params.description:
The underlying data transport is established
  and communication is possible. This is the initial state of a
  RTCDataChannel object dispatched as a part of a RTCDataChannelEvent.

params.name: CLOSING
params.description:
The procedure to close down the underlying
  data transport has started.

params.name: CLOSED
params.description:
The underlying data transport has been closed
  or could not be established.

params.name: ERROR
params.description: Datachannel has occurred an error.

classitems.description:
The list of api server data retrieval state.
- These are the states to inform the state of retrieving the
  information from the api server required to start the peer
  connection or if the browser is eligible to start the peer connection.
- This is the first event that would fired, because Skylink would retrieve
  information from the api server that is required to start the connection.
- Once the state is <u>COMPLETED</u>, Skylink is ready to start the call.
- The states that would occur are:
classitems.name: READY_STATE_CHANGE

params.name: INIT
params.description:
Skylink has just started. No information are
  retrieved yet.

params.name: LOADING
params.description:
Skylink is starting the retrieval of the
  connection information.

params.name: COMPLETED
params.description:
Skylink has completed retrieving the
  connection.

params.name: ERROR
params.description:
Skylink has occurred an error when
  retrieving the connection information.

classitems.description: The list of ready state change errors. - These are the error states from the error object error code. - ROOM_LOCKED is deprecated in 0.5.2. Please use {{#crossLink "Skylink/:attr"}}leaveRoom(){{/crossLink}} - The states that would occur are:
classitems.name: READY_STATE_CHANGE_ERROR

classitems.description: Intiailize Skylink to retrieve connection information. - IMPORTANT: Please call this method to load all server information before joining the room or doing anything else. - If you would like to set the start time and duration of the room, you have to generate the credentials. In example 3, we use the [CryptoJS](https://code.google.com/p/crypto-js/) library. - Step 1: Generate the hash. It is created by using the roomname, duration and the timestamp (in ISO String format). - Step 2: Generate the Credentials. It is is generated by converting the hash to a Base64 string and then encoding it to a URI string. - Step 3: Initialize Skylink
classitems.name: init

  backend server

  chooses to use. [Rel: Skylink.REGIONAL_SERVER]

  ICE trickle or not.
- Default is true.

props.name: dataChannel
props.description:
Optional. The option to enable
  datachannel or not.
- Default is true.

Optional. Credentials options for
  setting a static meeting.

The start timing of the
  meeting in Date ISO String

props.name: credentials
props.description:
The credentials required
  to set the timing and duration of a meeting.

classitems.description:
The list of ICE connection states.
- Check out the [w3 specification documentation](http://dev.w3.org/2011/
  webrtc/editor/webrtc.html#rtciceconnectionstate-enum).
- This is the RTCIceConnection state of the peer.
- The states that would occur are:
classitems.name: ICE_CONNECTION_STATE

params.name: STARTING
params.description:
The ICE agent is gathering addresses
  and/or waiting for remote candidates to be supplied.

params.name: CHECKING
params.description:
The ICE agent has received remote candidates
  on at least one component, and is checking candidate pairs but has
  not yet found a connection. In addition to checking, it may also
  still be gathering.

params.name: CONNECTED
params.description:
The ICE agent has found a usable connection
  for all components but is still checking other candidate pairs to see
  if there is a better connection. It may also still be gathering.

params.name: COMPLETED
params.description:
The ICE agent has finished gathering and
  checking and found a connection for all components.

params.name: FAILED
params.description:
The ICE agent is finished checking all
  candidate pairs and failed to find a connection for at least one
  component.

params.name: DISCONNECTED
params.description:
Liveness checks have failed for one or
  more components. This is more aggressive than "failed", and may
  trigger intermittently (and resolve itself without action) on
  a flaky network.

params.name: CLOSED
params.description:
The ICE agent has shut down and is no
  longer responding to STUN requests.

classitems.description: Intiailize Skylink to retrieve connection information. - IMPORTANT: Please call this method to load all server information before joining the room or doing anything else. - If you would like to set the start time and duration of the room, you have to generate the credentials. In example 3, we use the [CryptoJS](https://code.google.com/p/crypto-js/) library. - Step 1: Generate the hash. It is created by using the roomname, duration and the timestamp (in ISO String format). - Step 2: Generate the Credentials. It is is generated by converting the hash to a Base64 string and then encoding it to a URI string. - Step 3: Initialize Skylink

classitems.description:
The log levels.
- Logs are shown based on the level, if the level is highest, it shows logs
  which level are lower than theirs. If the level is lower, it shows only
  logs that are lower or are the same level, not the higher ones.
- Order from lowest to the highest is: error > warn > info > log > debug.
classitems.name: PEER_CONNECTION_STATE

params.name: DEBUG
params.description: Level 5. Shows debug logs.

params.name: TRACE
params.description: Level 4. Shows trace logs.

params.name: INFO
params.description: Level 3. Show informational logs related to user.

params.name: WARN
params.description: Level 2. Shows warnings.

params.name: ERROR
params.description:
Level 1. Shows the errors that are thrown during
  execution.

The fixed for each data chunk for firefox implementation.

classitems.description:
The list of signaling message types.
- These are the list of available signaling message types expected to
  be received.
- These message types are fixed.
- The available message types are:
classitems.name: _SIG_MESSAGE_TYPE

params.name:
JOIN_ROOM
-
params.description: Send: User request to join the room.

params.name:
IN_ROOM
-
params.description: Received: Response from server that user has joined the room.

params.name:
ENTER
-
params.description:
Send: Broadcast message to inform other connected peers in the room
  that the user is the new peer joining the room.
- Received: A peer has just joined the room.
  To send a welcome message.

params.name:
WELCOME
-
params.description:
Send: Respond to user to request peer to create the offer.
- Received: Response from peer that peer acknowledges the user has
  joined the room. To send and create an offer message.

params.name:
OFFER
-
params.description:
Send: Respond to peer's request to create an offer.
- Received: Response from peer's offer message. User to create and
  send an answer message.

params.name:
ANSWER
-
params.description:
Send: Response to peer's offer message.
- Received: Response from peer's answer message.
  Connection is established.

params.name:
CANDIDATE
-
params.description:
Send: User to send the ICE candidate after onicecandidate is called.
- Received: User to add peer's ice candidate in addIceCandidate.

params.name:
BYE
-
params.description: Received: Peer has left the room.

params.name:
REDIRECT
-
params.description: Received: Server warning to user.

params.name:
ERROR
-
params.description: Received: Deprecated. Server error occurred.

params.name:
UPDATE_USER
-
params.description:
Send: User's custom data is updated and to inform other peers
  of updated custom data.
- Received: Peer's user custom data has changed.

params.name:
ROOM_LOCK
-
params.description:
Send: Room lock action has changed and to inform other peers
  of updated room lock status.
- Received: Room lock status has changed.

params.name:
MUTE_VIDEO
-
params.description:
Send: User has muted video and to inform other peers
  of updated muted video stream status.
- Received: Peer muted video status has changed.

params.name:
MUTE_AUDIO
-
params.description:
Send: User has muted audio and to inform other peers
  of updated muted audio stream status.
- Received: Peer muted audio status has changed.

params.name:
PUBLIC_MESSAGE
-
params.description:
Send: User sends a broadcast message to all peers.
- Received: User receives a peer's broadcast message.

params.name:
PRIVATE_MESSAGE
-
params.description:
Send: User sends a private message to a peer.
- Received: User receives a private message from a peer.

classitems.description:
The list of datachannel message types.
- These are the list of available datachannel message types expected to
  be received.
- These message types are fixed.
- The available message types are:
classitems.name: _DC_PROTOCOL_TYPE

params.name:
WRQ
-
params.description:
Send: User request to transfer a data.
- Received: A peer has requested to transfer a data.

params.name:
ACK
-
params.description:
Send: User response to data transfer request.
- Received: Response from peer towards data transfer.
  - -1: Peer has rejected data transfer request.
  - 0: Peer has accepted data transfer request.
  - >0: Data transfer is going on.

params.name:
CANCEL
-
params.description:
Send: User canceled data transfer.
- Received: A peer has canceled data transfer.

params.name:
ERROR
-
params.description:
Send: Timeout waiting for peer response has exceeded limit.
- Received: Response from peer that timeout has reached its limit.
  Data transfer has failed.

params.name:
MESSAGE
-
params.description:
Send: User sends a P2P message.
- Received: A peer has sent a P2P message.

params.name: APAC1
params.description: Asia pacific server 1.

params.name: US1

classitems.description:
The list of ICE connection states.
- Check out the [w3 specification documentation](http://dev.w3.org/2011/
  webrtc/editor/webrtc.html#rtciceconnectionstate-enum).
- This is the RTCIceConnection state of the peer.
- The states that would occur are:
classitems.name: ICE_CONNECTION_STATE

params.name: STARTING
params.description:
The ICE agent is gathering addresses
  and/or waiting for remote candidates to be supplied.

params.name: CHECKING
params.description:
The ICE agent has received remote candidates
  on at least one component, and is checking candidate pairs but has
  not yet found a connection. In addition to checking, it may also
  still be gathering.

params.name: CONNECTED
params.description:
The ICE agent has found a usable connection
  for all components but is still checking other candidate pairs to see
  if there is a better connection. It may also still be gathering.

params.name: COMPLETED
params.description:
The ICE agent has finished gathering and
  checking and found a connection for all components.

params.name: FAILED
params.description:
The ICE agent is finished checking all
  candidate pairs and failed to find a connection for at least one
  component.

params.name: DISCONNECTED
params.description:
Liveness checks have failed for one or
  more components. This is more aggressive than "failed", and may
  trigger intermittently (and resolve itself without action) on
  a flaky network.

params.name: CLOSED
params.description:
The ICE agent has shut down and is no
  longer responding to STUN requests.

classitems.description:
The list of peer connection states.
- Check out the [w3 specification documentation](http://dev.w3.org/2011/
  webrtc/editor/webrtc.html#rtcpeerstate-enum).
- This is the RTCSignalingState of the peer.
- The states that would occur are:
classitems.name: PEER_CONNECTION_STATE

params.name: STABLE
params.description:
There is no offer/answer exchange in progress.
  This is also the initial state in which case the local and remote
  descriptions are empty.

params.name: HAVE_LOCAL_OFFER
params.description:
A local description, of type "offer",
  has been successfully applied.

params.name: HAVE_REMOTE_OFFER
params.description:
A remote description, of type "offer",
  has been successfully applied.

params.name: HAVE_LOCAL_PRANSWER
params.description:
A remote description of type "offer"
  has been successfully applied and a local description of type "pranswer"
  has been successfully applied.

params.name: HAVE_REMOTE_PRANSWER
params.description:
A local description of type "offer"
  has been successfully applied and a remote description of type
  "pranswer" has been successfully applied.

params.name: CLOSED
params.description: The connection is closed.

classitems.description:
The list of ICE candidate generation states.
- Check out the [w3 specification documentation](http://dev.w3.org/2011/
  webrtc/editor/webrtc.html#rtcicegatheringstate-enum).
- This is RTCIceGatheringState of the peer.
- The states that would occur are:
classitems.name: CANDIDATE_GENERATION_STATE

params.name: NEW
params.description:
The object was just created, and no networking
  has occurred yet.

params.name: GATHERING
params.description:
The ICE engine is in the process of gathering
  candidates for this RTCPeerConnection.

params.name: COMPLETED
params.description:
The ICE engine has completed gathering. Events
  such as adding a new interface or a new TURN server will cause the
  state to go back to gathering.

classitems.description:
The list of handshake progress steps.
- This are the list of steps for the Skylink peer connection.
- The steps that would occur are:
classitems.name: HANDSHAKE_PROGRESS

params.name: ENTER
params.description: Step 1. Received "enter" from peer.

params.name: WELCOME
params.description: Step 2. Received "welcome" from peer.

params.name: OFFER
params.description: Step 3. Received "offer" from peer.

params.name: ANSWER
params.description: Step 4. Received "answer" from peer.

params.name: ERROR
params.description: Error state.

classitems.description:
The list of datachannel states.
- Check out the [w3 specification documentation](http://dev.w3.org/2011/
  webrtc/editor/webrtc.html#idl-def-RTCDataChannelState).
- This is the RTCDataChannelState of the peer.
- <u>ERROR</u> is an additional implemented state by Skylink
  for further error tracking.
- The states that would occur are:
classitems.name: DATA_CHANNEL_STATE

params.name: CONNECTING
params.description:
The user agent is attempting to establish
  the underlying data transport. This is the initial state of a
  RTCDataChannel object created with createDataChannel().

params.name: OPEN
params.description:
The underlying data transport is established
  and communication is possible. This is the initial state of a
  RTCDataChannel object dispatched as a part of a RTCDataChannelEvent.

params.name: CLOSING
params.description:
The procedure to close down the underlying
  data transport has started.

params.name: CLOSED
params.description:
The underlying data transport has been closed
  or could not be established.

params.name: ERROR
params.description: Datachannel has occurred an error.

classitems.description:
The list of api server data retrieval state.
- These are the states to inform the state of retrieving the
  information from the api server required to start the peer
  connection or if the browser is eligible to start the peer connection.
- This is the first event that would fired, because Skylink would retrieve
  information from the api server that is required to start the connection.
- Once the state is <u>COMPLETED</u>, Skylink is ready to start the call.
- The states that would occur are:
classitems.name: READY_STATE_CHANGE

params.name: INIT
params.description:
Skylink has just started. No information are
  retrieved yet.

params.name: LOADING
params.description:
Skylink is starting the retrieval of the
  connection information.

params.name: COMPLETED
params.description:
Skylink has completed retrieving the
  connection.

params.name: ERROR
params.description:
Skylink has occurred an error when
  retrieving the connection information.

classitems.description: The list of ready state change errors. - These are the error states from the error object error code. - ROOM_LOCKED is deprecated in 0.5.2. Please use {{#crossLink "Skylink/:attr"}}leaveRoom(){{/crossLink}} - The states that would occur are:

classitems.description: Intiailize Skylink to retrieve connection information. - IMPORTANT: Please call this method to load all server information before joining the room or doing anything else. - If you would like to set the start time and duration of the room, you have to generate the credentials. In example 3, we use the [CryptoJS](https://code.google.com/p/crypto-js/) library. - Step 1: Generate the hash. It is created by using the roomname, duration and the timestamp (in ISO String format). - Step 2: Generate the Credentials. It is is generated by converting the hash to a Base64 string and then encoding it to a URI string. - Step 3: Initialize Skylink

classitems.description:
The list of ICE connection states.
- Check out the [w3 specification documentation](http://dev.w3.org/2011/
  webrtc/editor/webrtc.html#rtciceconnectionstate-enum).
- This is the RTCIceConnection state of the peer.
- The states that would occur are:
classitems.name: ICE_CONNECTION_STATE

params.name: STARTING
params.description:
The ICE agent is gathering addresses
  and/or waiting for remote candidates to be supplied.

params.name: CHECKING
params.description:
The ICE agent has received remote candidates
  on at least one component, and is checking candidate pairs but has
  not yet found a connection. In addition to checking, it may also
  still be gathering.

params.name: CONNECTED
params.description:
The ICE agent has found a usable connection
  for all components but is still checking other candidate pairs to see
  if there is a better connection. It may also still be gathering.

params.name: COMPLETED
params.description:
The ICE agent has finished gathering and
  checking and found a connection for all components.

params.name: FAILED
params.description:
The ICE agent is finished checking all
  candidate pairs and failed to find a connection for at least one
  component.

params.name: DISCONNECTED
params.description:
Liveness checks have failed for one or
  more components. This is more aggressive than "failed", and may
  trigger intermittently (and resolve itself without action) on
  a flaky network.

params.name: CLOSED
params.description:
The ICE agent has shut down and is no
  longer responding to STUN requests.

classitems.description: Intiailize Skylink to retrieve connection information. - IMPORTANT: Please call this method to load all server information before joining the room or doing anything else. - If you would like to set the start time and duration of the room, you have to generate the credentials. In example 3, we use the [CryptoJS](https://code.google.com/p/crypto-js/) library. - Step 1: Generate the hash. It is created by using the roomname, duration and the timestamp (in ISO String format). - Step 2: Generate the Credentials. It is is generated by converting the hash to a Base64 string and then encoding it to a URI string. - Step 3: Initialize Skylink
classitems.name: init

classitems.description:
The log levels.
- Logs are shown based on the level, if the level is highest, it shows logs
  which level are lower than theirs. If the level is lower, it shows only
  logs that are lower or are the same level, not the higher ones.
- Order from lowest to the highest is: error > warn > info > log > debug.
classitems.name: PEER_CONNECTION_STATE

params.description: Level 5. Shows debug logs.

params.name: TRACE
params.description: Level 4. Shows trace logs.

params.name: INFO
params.description: Level 3. Show informational logs related to user.

params.name: WARN
params.description: Level 2. Shows warnings.

params.name: ERROR
params.description:
Level 1. Shows the errors that are thrown during
  execution.

classitems.description:
The list of signaling message types.
- These are the list of available signaling message types expected to
  be received.
- These message types are fixed.
- The available message types are:
classitems.name: _SIG_MESSAGE_TYPE

params.name:
JOIN_ROOM
-
params.description: Send: User request to join the room.

params.name:
IN_ROOM
-
params.description: Received: Response from server that user has joined the room.

params.name:
ENTER
-
params.description:
Send: Broadcast message to inform other connected peers in the room
  that the user is the new peer joining the room.
- Received: A peer has just joined the room.
  To send a welcome message.

params.name:
WELCOME
-
params.description:
Send: Respond to user to request peer to create the offer.
- Received: Response from peer that peer acknowledges the user has
  joined the room. To send and create an offer message.

params.name:
OFFER
-
params.description:
Send: Respond to peer's request to create an offer.
- Received: Response from peer's offer message. User to create and
  send an answer message.

params.name:
ANSWER
-
params.description:
Send: Response to peer's offer message.
- Received: Response from peer's answer message.
  Connection is established.

params.name:
CANDIDATE
-
params.description:
Send: User to send the ICE candidate after onicecandidate is called.
- Received: User to add peer's ice candidate in addIceCandidate.

params.name:
BYE
-
params.description: Received: Peer has left the room.

params.name:
REDIRECT
-
params.description: Received: Server warning to user.

params.name:
ERROR
-
params.description: Received: Deprecated. Server error occurred.

params.name:
UPDATE_USER
-
params.description:
Send: User's custom data is updated and to inform other peers
  of updated custom data.
- Received: Peer's user custom data has changed.

params.name:
ROOM_LOCK
-
params.description:
Send: Room lock action has changed and to inform other peers
  of updated room lock status.
- Received: Room lock status has changed.

params.name:
MUTE_VIDEO
-
params.description:
Send: User has muted video and to inform other peers
  of updated muted video stream status.
- Received: Peer muted video status has changed.

params.name:
MUTE_AUDIO
-
params.description:
Send: User has muted audio and to inform other peers
  of updated muted audio stream status.
- Received: Peer muted audio status has changed.

params.name:
PUBLIC_MESSAGE
-
params.description:
Send: User sends a broadcast message to all peers.
- Received: User receives a peer's broadcast message.

params.name:
PRIVATE_MESSAGE
-
params.description:
Send: User sends a private message to a peer.
- Received: User receives a private message from a peer.

classitems.description:
The list of datachannel message types.
- These are the list of available datachannel message types expected to
  be received.
- These message types are fixed.
- The available message types are:
classitems.name: _DC_PROTOCOL_TYPE

params.name:
WRQ
-
params.description:
Send: User request to transfer a data.
- Received: A peer has requested to transfer a data.

params.name:
ACK
-
params.description:
Send: User response to data transfer request.
- Received: Response from peer towards data transfer.
  - -1: Peer has rejected data transfer request.
  - 0: Peer has accepted data transfer request.
  - >0: Data transfer is going on.

params.name:
CANCEL
-
params.description:
Send: User canceled data transfer.
- Received: A peer has canceled data transfer.

params.name:
ERROR
-
params.description:
Send: Timeout waiting for peer response has exceeded limit.
- Received: Response from peer that timeout has reached its limit.
  Data transfer has failed.

params.name:
MESSAGE
-
params.description:
Send: User sends a P2P message.
- Received: A peer has sent a P2P message.

classitems.description:
The list of ICE connection states.
- Check out the [w3 specification documentation](http://dev.w3.org/2011/
  webrtc/editor/webrtc.html#rtciceconnectionstate-enum).
- This is the RTCIceConnection state of the peer.
- The states that would occur are:
classitems.name: ICE_CONNECTION_STATE

params.name: STARTING
params.description:
The ICE agent is gathering addresses
  and/or waiting for remote candidates to be supplied.

params.name: CHECKING
params.description:
The ICE agent has received remote candidates
  on at least one component, and is checking candidate pairs but has
  not yet found a connection. In addition to checking, it may also
  still be gathering.

params.name: CONNECTED
params.description:
The ICE agent has found a usable connection
  for all components but is still checking other candidate pairs to see
  if there is a better connection. It may also still be gathering.

params.name: COMPLETED
params.description:
The ICE agent has finished gathering and
  checking and found a connection for all components.

params.name: FAILED
params.description:
The ICE agent is finished checking all
  candidate pairs and failed to find a connection for at least one
  component.

params.name: DISCONNECTED
params.description:
Liveness checks have failed for one or
  more components. This is more aggressive than "failed", and may
  trigger intermittently (and resolve itself without action) on
  a flaky network.

params.name: CLOSED
params.description:
The ICE agent has shut down and is no
  longer responding to STUN requests.

classitems.description:
The list of peer connection states.
- Check out the [w3 specification documentation](http://dev.w3.org/2011/
  webrtc/editor/webrtc.html#rtcpeerstate-enum).
- This is the RTCSignalingState of the peer.
- The states that would occur are:
classitems.name: PEER_CONNECTION_STATE

params.name: STABLE
params.description:
There is no offer/answer exchange in progress.
  This is also the initial state in which case the local and remote
  descriptions are empty.

params.name: HAVE_LOCAL_OFFER
params.description:
A local description, of type "offer",
  has been successfully applied.

params.name: HAVE_REMOTE_OFFER
params.description:
A remote description, of type "offer",
  has been successfully applied.

params.name: HAVE_LOCAL_PRANSWER
params.description:
A remote description of type "offer"
  has been successfully applied and a local description of type "pranswer"
  has been successfully applied.

params.name: HAVE_REMOTE_PRANSWER
params.description:
A local description of type "offer"
  has been successfully applied and a remote description of type
  "pranswer" has been successfully applied.

params.name: CLOSED
params.description: The connection is closed.

classitems.description:
The list of ICE candidate generation states.
- Check out the [w3 specification documentation](http://dev.w3.org/2011/
  webrtc/editor/webrtc.html#rtcicegatheringstate-enum).
- This is RTCIceGatheringState of the peer.
- The states that would occur are:
classitems.name: CANDIDATE_GENERATION_STATE

params.name: NEW
params.description:
The object was just created, and no networking
  has occurred yet.

params.name: GATHERING
params.description:
The ICE engine is in the process of gathering
  candidates for this RTCPeerConnection.

params.name: COMPLETED
params.description:
The ICE engine has completed gathering. Events
  such as adding a new interface or a new TURN server will cause the
  state to go back to gathering.

classitems.description:
The list of handshake progress steps.
- This are the list of steps for the Skylink peer connection.
- The steps that would occur are:
classitems.name: HANDSHAKE_PROGRESS

params.name: ENTER
params.description: Step 1. Received "enter" from peer.

params.name: WELCOME
params.description: Step 2. Received "welcome" from peer.

params.name: OFFER
params.description: Step 3. Received "offer" from peer.

params.name: ANSWER
params.description: Step 4. Received "answer" from peer.

classitems.description:
The list of datachannel states.
- Check out the [w3 specification documentation](http://dev.w3.org/2011/
  webrtc/editor/webrtc.html#idl-def-RTCDataChannelState).
- This is the RTCDataChannelState of the peer.
- <u>ERROR</u> is an additional implemented state by Skylink
  for further error tracking.
- The states that would occur are:
classitems.name: DATA_CHANNEL_STATE

params.name: CONNECTING
params.description:
The user agent is attempting to establish
  the underlying data transport. This is the initial state of a
  RTCDataChannel object created with createDataChannel().

params.name: OPEN
params.description:
The underlying data transport is established
  and communication is possible. This is the initial state of a
  RTCDataChannel object dispatched as a part of a RTCDataChannelEvent.

params.name: CLOSING
params.description:
The procedure to close down the underlying
  data transport has started.

params.name: CLOSED
params.description:
The underlying data transport has been closed
  or could not be established.

params.name: ERROR
params.description: Datachannel has occurred an error.

classitems.description:
The list of api server data retrieval state.
- These are the states to inform the state of retrieving the
  information from the api server required to start the peer
  connection or if the browser is eligible to start the peer connection.
- This is the first event that would fired, because Skylink would retrieve
  information from the api server that is required to start the connection.
- Once the state is <u>COMPLETED</u>, Skylink is ready to start the call.
- The states that would occur are:
classitems.name: READY_STATE_CHANGE

params.name: INIT
params.description:
Skylink has just started. No information are
  retrieved yet.

params.name: LOADING
params.description:
Skylink is starting the retrieval of the
  connection information.

params.name: COMPLETED
params.description:
Skylink has completed retrieving the
  connection.

params.name: ERROR
params.description:
Skylink has occurred an error when
  retrieving the connection information.

classitems.description: The list of ready state change errors. - These are the error states from the error object error code. - ROOM_LOCKED is deprecated in 0.5.2. Please use {{#crossLink "Skylink/:attr"}}leaveRoom(){{/crossLink}} - The states that would occur are:
classitems.name: READY_STATE_CHANGE_ERROR

params.name: API_INVALID
params.description: Api Key provided does not exist.

params.name: API_DOMAIN_NOT_MATCH
params.description:
Api Key used in domain does
  not match.

params.name: API_CORS_DOMAIN_NOT_MATCH
params.description:
Api Key used in CORS
  domain does not match.

params.name: API_CREDENTIALS_INVALID
params.description:
Api Key credentials does
  not exist.

params.name: API_CREDENTIALS_NOT_MATCH
params.description:
Api Key credentials does not
  match what is expected.

params.name: API_INVALID_PARENT_KEY
params.description:
Api Key does not have a parent
  key nor is a root key.

params.name: API_NOT_ENOUGH_CREDIT
params.description:
Api Key does not have enough
  credits to use.

params.name: API_NOT_ENOUGH_PREPAID_CREDIT
params.description:
Api Key does not have
  enough prepaid credits to use.

params.name: API_FAILED_FINDING_PREPAID_CREDIT
params.description:
Api Key preapid
  payments does not exist.

params.name: API_NO_MEETING_RECORD_FOUND
params.description:
Api Key does not have a
  meeting record at this timing. This occurs when Api Key is a
  static one.

params.name: ROOM_LOCKED
params.description: Room is locked.

params.name: NO_SOCKET_IO
params.description: No socket.io dependency is loaded to use.

params.name: NO_XMLHTTPREQUEST_SUPPORT
params.description:
Browser does not support
  XMLHttpRequest to use.

params.name: NO_WEBRTC_SUPPORT
params.description: Browser does not have WebRTC support.

params.name: NO_PATH
params.description: No path is loaded yet.

params.name: INVALID_XMLHTTPREQUEST_STATUS
params.description:
Invalid XMLHttpRequest
  when retrieving information.

Data transfer of download has

params.description:
User sends quick messages
  less than a second resulting in a warning. Continuous
  quick messages results in user being kicked out of the room.

params.name: ROOM_LOCKED
params.description:
Room is locked and user is locked
  from joining the room.

params.name: ROOM_FULL
params.description: Persistent meeting. Room is full.

params.name: DUPLICATED_LOGIN
params.description: User has same id

params.name: SERVER_ERROR
params.description: Server has an error

params.name: VERIFICATION
params.description: Verification for roomID

params.name: EXPIRED
params.description:
Persistent meeting. Room has
  expired and user is unable to join the room.

params.name: ROOM_CLOSED
params.description:
Persistent meeting. Room
  has expired and is closed, user to leave the room.

params.name: ROOM_CLOSING
params.description:
Persistent meeting.
  Room is closing soon.

params.name: OVER_SEAT_LIMIT
params.description:
Seat limit is hit. API Key
  do not have sufficient seats to continue.

classitems.description: Intiailize Skylink to retrieve connection information. - IMPORTANT: Please call this method to load all server information before joining the room or doing anything else. - If you would like to set the start time and duration of the room, you have to generate the credentials. In example 3, we use the [CryptoJS](https://code.google.com/p/crypto-js/) library. - Step 1: Generate the hash. It is created by using the roomname, duration and the timestamp (in ISO String format). - Step 2: Generate the Credentials. It is is generated by converting the hash to a Base64 string and then encoding it to a URI string. - Step 3: Initialize Skylink
classitems.name: init

params.name: options
params.description: Connection options or API Key ID

props.name: apiKey
props.description:
API Key ID to identify with the Temasys
  backend server

props.name: defaultRoom

  to if there is no room provided in
  {{#crossLink "Skylink/joinRoom:method"}}joinRoom(){{/crossLink}}.

props.name: roomServer
props.description:
Optional. Path to the Temasys
  backend server. If there's no room provided, default room would be used.

props.name: region
props.description:
Optional. The regional server that user
  chooses to use. [Rel: Skylink.REGIONAL_SERVER]

props.name: iceTrickle
props.description:
Optional. The option to enable
  ICE trickle or not.
- Default is true.

props.name: dataChannel
props.description:
Optional. The option to enable
  datachannel or not.
- Default is true.

props.name: credentials
props.description:
Optional. Credentials options for
  setting a static meeting.

props.name: startDateTime
props.description:
The start timing of the
  meeting in Date ISO String

props.name: credentials
props.description:
The credentials required
  to set the timing and duration of a meeting.

classitems.description:
The log levels.
- Logs are shown based on the level, if the level is highest, it shows logs
  which level are lower than theirs. If the level is lower, it shows only
  logs that are lower or are the same level, not the higher ones.
- Order from lowest to the highest is: error > warn > info > log > debug.
classitems.name: PEER_CONNECTION_STATE

params.name: DEBUG
params.description: Level 5. Shows debug logs.

params.name: TRACE
params.description: Level 4. Shows trace logs.

params.name: INFO
params.description: Level 3. Show informational logs related to user.

params.name: WARN
params.description: Level 2. Shows warnings.

params.name: ERROR
params.description:
Level 1. Shows the errors that are thrown during
  execution.

classitems.description:
Sends a message to the signaling server.
- Not to be confused with method
  {{#crossLink "Skylink/sendMessage:method"}}sendMessage(){{/crossLink}}
  that broadcasts messages. This is for sending socket messages.
classitems.name: _sendChannelMessage

classitems.description:
The list of signaling message types.
- These are the list of available signaling message types expected to
  be received.
- These message types are fixed.
- The available message types are:
classitems.name: _SIG_MESSAGE_TYPE

params.name:
JOIN_ROOM
-
params.description: Send: User request to join the room.

params.name:
IN_ROOM
-
params.description: Received: Response from server that user has joined the room.

params.name:
ENTER
-
params.description:
Send: Broadcast message to inform other connected peers in the room
  that the user is the new peer joining the room.
- Received: A peer has just joined the room.
  To send a welcome message.

params.name:
WELCOME
-
params.description:
Send: Respond to user to request peer to create the offer.
- Received: Response from peer that peer acknowledges the user has
  joined the room. To send and create an offer message.

params.name:
OFFER
-
params.description:
Send: Respond to peer's request to create an offer.
- Received: Response from peer's offer message. User to create and
  send an answer message.

params.name:
ANSWER
-
params.description:
Send: Response to peer's offer message.
- Received: Response from peer's answer message.
  Connection is established.

params.name:
CANDIDATE
-
params.description:
Send: User to send the ICE candidate after onicecandidate is called.
- Received: User to add peer's ice candidate in addIceCandidate.

params.name:
BYE
-
params.description: Received: Peer has left the room.

params.name:
REDIRECT
-
params.description: Received: Server warning to user.

params.name:
ERROR
-
params.description: Received: Deprecated. Server error occurred.

params.name:
UPDATE_USER
-
params.description:
Send: User's custom data is updated and to inform other peers
  of updated custom data.
- Received: Peer's user custom data has changed.

params.name:
ROOM_LOCK
-
params.description:
Send: Room lock action has changed and to inform other peers
  of updated room lock status.
- Received: Room lock status has changed.

params.name:
MUTE_VIDEO
-
params.description:
Send: User has muted video and to inform other peers
  of updated muted video stream status.
- Received: Peer muted video status has changed.

params.name:
MUTE_AUDIO
-
params.description:
Send: User has muted audio and to inform other peers
  of updated muted audio stream status.
- Received: Peer muted audio status has changed.

params.name:
PUBLIC_MESSAGE
-
params.description:
Send: User sends a broadcast message to all peers.
- Received: User receives a peer's broadcast message.

params.name:
PRIVATE_MESSAGE
-
params.description:
Send: User sends a private message to a peer.
- Received: User receives a private message from a peer.

classitems.description:
Handles everu incoming signaling message received.
- If it's a SIG_TYPE.GROUP message, break them down to single messages
  and let {{#crossLink "Skylink/_processSingleMessage:method"}}
  _processSingleMessage(){{/crossLink}} to handle them.

Signaling server sends a enter message.

- This occurs when we've just received a welcome.

  create one, then set the remotedescription and answer.

classitems.description:
Enable microphone.
- If microphone is not enabled from the beginning, user would have to reinitate the
  {{#crossLink "Skylink/joinRoom:method"}}joinRoom(){{/crossLink}}
  process and ask for microphone again.
classitems.name: enableAudio

classitems.description:
Disable microphone.
- If microphone is not enabled from the beginning, there is no effect.
classitems.name: disableAudio

classitems.description:
Enable webcam video.
- If webcam is not enabled from the beginning, user would have to reinitate the
  {{#crossLink "Skylink/joinRoom:method"}}joinRoom(){{/crossLink}}
  process and ask for webcam again.
classitems.name: enableVideo

classitems.description:
Disable webcam video.
- If webcam is not enabled from the beginning, there is no effect.
- Note that in a Chrome-to-chrome session, each party's peer audio
  may appear muted in when the audio is muted.
- You may follow up the bug on [here](https://github.com/Temasys/SkylinkJS/issues/14).
classitems.name: disableVideo
